Throughout my career, I have strategically chosen to immerse myself in the dynamic fields of venture capital and private equity. My path includes significant roles with Korea Venture Investment Corp (KVIC) as LP and impactful stints in private equity in Hong Kong. These experiences have equipped me with a keen ability to identify and nurture high-potential ventures. Driven by a passion for innovation and strategic investment, I continue to advance in the ever-evolving landscape of finance and technology.

Founder & Managing Partner, MISSION Law Firm | Advocate for Cross-Border Startups & Venture Investments | Adjunct Professor at Yonsei Law School
Building a community of hospitality and solidarity beyond borders, for a better world for future generations.

I am the founder and managing partner of Mission Law Firm, specializing in venture investment and startup ecosystems. My role encompasses shaping Mission's vision and strategic direction, dedicated to serving startups as a trusted neighbor and reliable partner, ensuring innovators receive the comprehensive legal and strategic support needed to thrive.
Areas of Expertise

I have expertise and experience in structuring venture investments, M&A transactions, and guiding startups through cross-border expansion. My practice emphasizes solving the complex legal and regulatory challenges inherent in cross-border business activities. Additionally, I have a strong interest in the societal implications of artificial intelligence and the establishment of balanced regulations that harmonize technological advancements with societal values.
Policy and Advisory Roles

I actively advise on national policies and legislation aimed at fostering sustainable startup ecosystems. My advisory roles span multiple governmental and private-sector committees, focusing on regulatory innovation and reform to create a supportive environment for venture investments and entrepreneurial growth.
Academic and Research Activities

As an Adjunct Professor at Yonsei University Law School, I have developed and teach pioneering legal education programs specifically tailored for entrepreneurs and venture investors. My educational approach integrates legal expertise, business acumen, and technological insights, nurturing future leaders who are equipped to navigate complex global markets. Furthermore, my research addresses the impact of AI on democracy and society, advocating for responsible governance frameworks to guide the development and use of AI technologies.

Dr. Hong is a Professor and former Dean of the Graduate School of Environmental Studies at Seoul National University. After receiving his PhD at Cornell University, he held positions at Korea Development Institute and College of Economics and Finance at Hanyang University, He has previously served as the President of the Asian Association of Environmental and Resource Economics, the Korean Association of Public Finance, and Korea Environmental Economics Association. His served as Chairman of the Energy Transition Forum of Korea and Co-President of the Korean Federation for Environmental Movement. He is the author of the award-winning book, Climate Crisis the Great Shift of Wealth.

Haina Kang is Senior Climate and Energy Policy Officer at British Embassy Seoul. Prior to joining the British Embassy Seoul, she also worked for World Wildlife Fund (WWF), Korea Adaptation Center for Climate Change, United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific (UNESCAP) and Korean Embassy in Dhaka, Bangladesh. She has over a decades experience in promoting climate action and accelerating the transition to a net-zero economy.
